DOC.brief_title: Methadone Maintenance Treatment ( MMT ) Care HIV Prevention
DOC.detailed_description: Injecting drug use major mode HIV transmission 740,000 people live HIV ( PLH ) China . In response situation , China introduce methadone maintenance treatment ( MMT ) 2004 , dispense 701 clinic serve 295,000 client . Despite impressive scale-up , China 's MMT program still face serious challenge , include high drop-out rate , large number client continue use heroin MMT , gap client ' need service availability , provider ' lack skill counsel education , stigma link resistance harm reduction . This study aim address challenge . Based previous success intervention pilot ( R34MH083512 ) , conduct randomize control trial ( MMT CARE ) , integrate behavioral intervention component primarily pharmacological model MMT . The intervention focus treatment adherence effective outcome reduce stigmatize attitude behavior among service provider , enhance communication skill , improve interaction support client ' behavior change . Our goal bring contextual change support protective environment client ' motivation capacity order reduce HIV risk . The finding could benefit China also global community effectively combine intervention control HIV epidemic . The study implement Sichuan , Guangdong , Hunan , Shaanxi Jiangsu province . A total 68 MMT clinic randomly select five province randomize either intervention condition ( MMT CARE group ) control condition . From select clinic , recruit 6 service provider 36 client , total 408 service provider 2,448 client ( 204 service provider 1,224 client condition , respectively ) . The Specific Aims study follow : 1 . To examine whether provider intervention group , compare provider control group , demonstrate improve adherence MMT protocol , decrease prejudicial attitude , increase interaction client , increase communication client risk reduction . 2 . To examine whether MMT client intervention group , compare client control group , demonstrate improve treatment adherence/retention , decreased concurrent drug use , increase motivation behavior change , improve mental health , increase positive support , reduce HIV risk behavior . 3 . To explore whether provider ' improve outcome associate improved client outcome .
